reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Efficient welcome but tatty reception. The first room we were allocated was freezing, the sofa bed was ripped and carpet stained. But worst of all, we soon realised that it hadn't been cleaned since the previous occupant (dirty toilet, wet towel hanging up and - yuck - a bed full of hairs and crumbs and god knows what else). It took some persuasion but eventually we were given another room which was at least relatively clean and we were given a complimentary 'lite' breakfast for our troubles.
reviews.title: Avoid if you can

reviews.text: We stopped here because we needed to break a long drive up to Scotland - if we were making the journey again, I'd do everything I could to find an alternative place to stay. We've stayed in some really good Travelodges - the company needs to apply its standards more consistently!
reviews.title: HHHHMMMMMMMMM?????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I never expect much from the "old school" style of travelodges in this country but it does irritate me when they still feel okay about charging people for serioulsy down market rooms.
reviews.title: Urgent refurbishment needed

likes.liked: — Convenient location en route for holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Refurbishment is on the cards and I can't fault the friendly, helpful nature of the staff but the room was awful. The spy hole had been taped over and filled in with tissue, the door didn't close properly, scrapes all over the walls, new sink and toilet but bath very old, carpet stained, double glazing failing and dead flies all over the windowsill.
reviews.title: Never mind the quality, feel the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only paid £19 per night so we can't REALLY complain but they are still charging £51 per night if you don't find the bargains.
reviews.title: another trip another travelodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a great stop off on the way to the Lake District. We stopped here for one night. We pre booked it on travelodge web site so
reviews.title: Great stop

reviews.text: got a huge discount..The hotel is well run, friendly staff. The room was as expected and when we asked for extra pillows not a problem. I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Worst ever stay in travelodge

reviews.text: When we arrived, there was a load of old smelly carpet left outside the reception. As we walked down the corridor to our room, the smell hit us - it was a terrible damp, stagnent water smell. The room also smelt of it but not as bad as the corridor. They had obviously had some sort of flood or damp problem, hence the old carpet dumped by reception.
reviews.title: A well run Travelodge

likes.disliked: — The adjacent motorway service area is grotty and needs refurbished.

reviews.text: Near to wear we parked the car, there was a dead rabbit, half covered up by a mat.
reviews.title: Fine for an Overnight
Excellent base for the Lake District
reviews.text: In the room, the shower didnt work, there was no remote for the TV and the room was flithy.
